name: ResponsiveSigning
title: Responsive Signing
shortDescription: Convert a file to HTML for responsive signing
sampleFeatures:
This sample features

  • Envelopes
  • Remote signing
  • Responsive signing
  • Tabs
codeFlow:
Code flow

Step 1

An Envelopes:create call defines the envelope, including the document to be converted to HTML. The HTML version is scalable, making it easier for the recipient to view and sign on a mobile device. After the recipient has signed the HTML version, the completed document is converted to PDF. The request also specifies a signature tab whose position is based on anchor text. When this request is sent, the envelope is created and immediately sent to the signer, whose name and email are included in the call.
description:
Prerequisites

To run this scenario, you’ll need a file that you can select to use as the document to be converted to HTML and signed.

Scenario execution instructions

To execute the API call

Do either of the following:

  • Select Step 1 in the left navigation and follow the instructions on the page.
  • Supply all required values in the Parameters section below and select Execute.

To execute the API call multiple times

  1. Enter the number of executions in the Options section.
  2. Supply all required values in the Parameters section.
    Note: You can configure a parameter to have a unique value for each execution by inserting the text {random} or {iteration}, including the curly braces, anywhere in the value. At execution time, {random} will be replaced with a random number and {iteration} will be replaced with the number of the execution.
  3. Select Execute.

steps.name: ResponsiveSigning_Step_1
steps.title: Step 1: Create an envelope containing a signable HTML document
steps.description:
To execute this API call:

  1. Supply all parameter values below.
    Note: You can configure a parameter to have a unique value by inserting the text {random}, including the curly braces, anywhere in the value. At execution time, {random} will be replaced with a random number.
  2. Select Execute.

parametersPrompts.name: signerName
parametersPrompts.title: Signer name
parametersPrompts.note: The name of the recipient who will sign the document.

parametersPrompts.name: signerEmail
parametersPrompts.title: Signer email
parametersPrompts.note: The signer’s email address. The envelope will be sent to this address.

parametersPrompts.name: document1
parametersPrompts.title: Document
parametersPrompts.note: A document that will be converted to HTML and displayed for the envelope recipient to sign. Most common file types are supported.

parametersPrompts.name: docname
parametersPrompts.title: Document name
parametersPrompts.note: A name to identify the document. This name will appear in the email that is sent to the recipient.

parametersPrompts.name: anchorString
parametersPrompts.title: Anchor string
parametersPrompts.note: A word or phrase in the selected file that identifies the area where the signature tab should appear. This is the anchor component of the anchor tagging feature. This value is not case-sensitive. Note: If the value entered here does not exist in the selected document, an API error response will be returned.

parametersPrompts.name: anchorXOffset
parametersPrompts.title: X offset
parametersPrompts.note: The number of points to the right of the anchor string (defined above) for placement of the signature tab. A point is equal to one 72nd of an inch. The position specified here applies to the completed PDF version of the document, not the HTML version.

parametersPrompts.name: anchorYOffset
parametersPrompts.title: Y offset
parametersPrompts.note: The number of points below the anchor string (defined above) for placement of the signature tab. A point is equal to one 72nd of an inch. The position specified here applies to the completed PDF version of the document, not the HTML version.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The external account number (int) or account ID GUID.
